result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Lamont Hull Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and compliance with treatment. Random UA's and breathalyzers. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Complete mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.

No contact with T.L.B.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation and 10/24/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation and by 10/24/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Lamont Hull Jr

defendant.name: Hull, Phillip Lamont, Jr
defendant.address: 4713 West Fond du Lac Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53216

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Phillip Lamont Hull Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Phillip Lamont Hull Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Serve 10 days condition time with Huber for work.  
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Random UA's and breathalyzers. 
- Complete mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.
- No contact with TLB.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation and 10/24/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation and by 10/24/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Phillip Lamont Hull Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Phillip Lamont Hull Jr.  Attorney Navjot Hira in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in victim witness compliance.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court, defendant Phillip Lamont Hull not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court previously stayed a bench warrant.  Defendant is in custody.  Court withdrew the stayed bench warrant and cancelled the calendar call date.  Court set a scheduling conference date.  This matter will be held in person in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court advised that the defendant is currently in custody at the House of Correction.

Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court set a calendar call date.  This matter will be held in person in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Milwaukee County Transit System. No contact with Thelma B.

Defendant Phillip Lamont Hull in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Phillip Lamont Hull in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Phillip Lamont Hull appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
